body_html:
Sounds good. We got it installed here just a little bit ago, so I'll take a stab at it sometime.

In case I don't, the slurm manager here pointed me to two scripts he wrote to parse out the slurm nodelist in perl that may be helpful for generating that list:
https://github.com/SchedMD/slurm/blob/slurm-16.05/contribs/torque/generate_pbs_nodefile.pl
https://github.com/SchedMD/slurm/blob/78bb5093c37da90ab4206639d6028b358a296370/contribs/torque/generate_pbs_nodefile.pl
He said the second might be easier to use, since it wasn't using the slurm perl API that the first link uses.

Also, this [SO post](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34826736/running-tensorflow-on-a-slurm-cluster has a few pointers) has some tips.

body:
Sounds good.  We got it installed here just a little bit ago, so I'll take a stab at it sometime.  

In case I don't, the slurm manager here pointed me to two scripts he wrote to parse out the slurm nodelist in perl that may be helpful for generating that list:
https://github.com/SchedMD/slurm/blob/slurm-16.05/contribs/torque/generate_pbs_nodefile.pl
https://github.com/SchedMD/slurm/blob/78bb5093c37da90ab4206639d6028b358a296370/contribs/torque/generate_pbs_nodefile.pl
He said the second might be easier to use, since it wasn't using the slurm perl API that the first link uses.

Also, this [SO post](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34826736/running-tensorflow-on-a-slurm-cluster has a few pointers) has some tips.
